subject: Career
title: The Identity Crisis of Leaving a Career
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Identity Crisis of Leaving a Career usable.

hook.text: 'I'm a lawyer.' For 15 years, that's who she was. Now she's leaving. Who is she without the title?

buildup.text: We merge our identity with our profession. Leaving a career feels like losing a part of yourself.

discovery.text: Herminia Ibarra calls this the 'identity transition' â€” you must let go of one self to build another.

twist.text: The grief is real. Psychologists found career transitions trigger stages similar to mourning.

climax.text: Reframe: you're not losing identity. You're expanding it. The old skills and experiences remain.

punchline.text: You're not starting over. You're starting from everything you've learned.

quiz.question: What did Herminia Ibarra call the process of leaving a career?
